list_definition.definition: to hear and try (cases) in a court of law

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Who will be judging this case?

list_definition.definition: to decide which is the best in a competition etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Is she going to judge the singing competition again?
Who will be judging the vegetables at the flower show?
Who is judging at the horse show?

list_definition.definition: to consider and form an idea of; to estimate

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You can’t judge a man by his appearance
Watch how a cat judges the distance before it jumps
She couldn’t judge whether he was telling the truth.
We have no right to judge him – we might have done the same thing ourselves.

list_definition.definition: a public officer who hears and decides cases in a law court

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The judge asked if the jury had reached a verdict.

list_definition.definition: a person who decides which is the best in a competition etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The judge’s decision is final (= you cannot argue with the judge’s decision)
He was asked to be on the panel of judges at the beauty contest.

list_definition.definition: a person who is skilled at deciding how good etc something is

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He says she’s honest, and he’s a good judge of character
He seems a very fine pianist to me, but I’m no judge.

list_ex_of_english: On the contrar y, judges accept the same tr uth conditions for propositions of law.
Subjects first judged the modulus item and then all the items in the training set.
We needed a criterion for when a structure should be judged as acquired by the learner.
The role of judges seems much more important.
In empirical studies, observer accuracy is usually judged by the degree to which the observer's rating matches the subject's rating of pain.
Such models may be judged successful if the defining criterion is that it describes the space of possible analyses that sentences may get.
Moreover, they must be sensitive to the success or failure of their subjects' actions so that compensator y action may be taken if judged appropriate.
The best interest will be judged by the professional.
